episodes.title: 500: Evolution
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An interview with TreeGirl Julianne Skai Arbor. TreeGirl talks about her passion and her new photography book showing her posed with amazing, majestic trees from around the world.

episodes.title: 499: The Photographers Dilemma
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A Photographer captures an isolated Amazonian tribe. Magic Lantern unlocks your Canon’s hidden powers. Ten things to consider before starting a 365 Project. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Dave Dugdale and Sara France.

episodes.title: 498: CES 2017 Round Up
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Frederick and Tim Engle start the New Year with their take on the latest photo tech from CES 2017.

episodes.title: 497: Good Riddance 2016
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Got a new camera for the holidays? Now What? Going full-time as an Instagram photographer. Plus setting photographic goals for 2017. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Tim Engle and J.M. Giordano.

episodes.title: 496: Just Photographers Talking Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A marketing campaign targeting terrible photographers wanting perfect shots. Photojournalists ask for encrypted cameras. Plus working pros talk about the future of photography. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Matt Granger and Andy Biggs.

episodes.title: 495: 'Tis the Season
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe updates Lightroom and Camera Raw. Instagram rolls out live video for US users. Time Magazine trolls Donald Trump. Plus holiday gift suggestions for photographers. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Don Komarechka and Craig Colvin.

episodes.title: 494: Beautifully Aging Beauty
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Pirelli shows the beauty of age. Are photographers flocking to Microsoft? Phase One releases Capture One Pro 10. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Martin Bailey and Jose Rosado.

episodes.title: 493: What’s Next for GoPro?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: GoPro lays off 200 employees. Instagram adds live streaming and disappearing photos. 500px wants to be the 'Uber' for photographers. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Evgeny Tchebotarev, Chris Berry, and Steve Brazill.

episodes.title: 492: Goodbye Casey Neistat
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Vlogger Casey Neistat retires! More drones from DJI. Google wants to turn your phone into a scanner. Plus Apple's latest product requires zero electricity! Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Christine Alward and Greg Benz.

episodes.title: 491: The Gravity of Karma
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: GoPro recalls its Karma drone. Snapchats’s new Spectacle shades. And Microsoft plans to bring 3D to everyone. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests, Tim Engle and Jose Rosado.

episodes.title: 490: The Creative's Cloud
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe updates Creative Cloud apps and makes big changes to Adobe Stock service. Photojournalism coverage of Cubs World Series win is lost. Plus insights into the recent Internet disruption. Join Frederick and his guests, Martin Bailey and Craig Colvin.

episodes.title: 489: Wanderlust and New Gear
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Microsoft’s Surface Studio PC is a creative dream. Apple updates the MacBook pro with new touch bar. Sweden bans drones in public places. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guest, Federico Chieli.

episodes.title: 488: Making Copyright Great Again
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Trump campaign lifts photos from Flickr without permission. Kodak enters the smartphone game. Nikon goes multi-lens. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Varina and Jay Patel.

episodes.title: 487: Amputees En Vogue
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sony’s new 4K Action Cam. Paralympic athletes replaced with able-bodied models in Vogue campaign. Plus a tourist is jailed for flying his drone in Havana. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Christine Alward and Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 486: Google Grabs Them with Pixel
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sony introduces the a6500 with world’s fastest AF. Google unveils the Pixel phone. And Zoom debuts the Q8 A/V recorder. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Mike "Sharky" James.

episodes.title: 485: Shoot First? Or Ask First?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An "ask first" controversy at BDSM Fair. Sony unveils the a99 II. Plus Fujifilm announces a GFX mirrorless camera with 51.4 megapixels. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Sara France and Juan Pons.

episodes.title: 484: DJI Strikes Back!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DJI answers GoPro with Karma. Flickr remains relevant as Yahoo circles the drain. And Panasonic reveals the GH5 that shoots 6K video! Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Cheryl Dorskind and Joseph Linaschke.

episodes.title: 483: Top Picks from Photokina
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Frederick Van Johnson, Don Komarechka and newbie Steve Brazil share their favorite picks from Photokina. Plus a look at the Pentax K-1.

episodes.title: 482: iPhone 7 Arrives
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple announces the iPhone 7. Google Photos for iOS lets you stabilize Live Photos. And Facebook censors the historic “Napalm Girl” photo. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Andy Biggs and Shiv Verma.

episodes.title: 481: Photokina Preview
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The Photokino tradeshow features DJI’s and GoPro’s new drones. Plus Garmin enters the fray with an action camera that takes direct aim at GoPro!. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Shiv Verma and Doug Kaye.

episodes.title: 480: Did Steve Jobs Change Photography?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Steve Jobs will be inducted into the International Photography Hall of Fame. Smugmug rescues stranded PictureLife customers. And the FAA finally rules that commercial drone use is legal. Join Frederick and his guests Jose Rosado and Bryan Caporicci.

episodes.title: 479: Smoke and Mirrors
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Dual Pixel RAW coming to the Canon 5D Mark IV. GoPro releases a 6 camera Omni VR rig. And VSCO opens a free-to-use studio in New York. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Juan Pons and Joseph Linaschke.

episodes.title: 478: The Rise and Fall of Brooks Institute
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Frederick and Jeffrey Burke, former Chairman of the Brooks Institute Board, discuss the impact of the school’s closure, the student and faculty’s future, and for-profit education in general.

episodes.title: 477: Embrace and Extend
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Instagram Stories imitates Snapchat Stories. A photographer sues Getty Images for $1B after being billed for her own photo. Plus cool new tech that can print holograms with regular InkJet printers. Join Frederick and his guests Sara France and Doug Kaye.

episodes.title: 476: Gotta Catch 'Em All!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Tim Engle chases Pokemons. Nikon unveils the 105mm f1.4E portrait lens. Plus Fuji film announces the Instax Share SP-2 mobile printer. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Tim Engle and Craig Colvin.

episodes.title: 475: Did You Yahoo?!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Verizon buys Yahoo. What does this mean for Yahoo’s Flickr? Canon lenses may soon have digital displays. And a Victoria’s Secret retoucher reveals her techniques. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Giulio Sciorio and Jose Rosado.

episodes.title: 474: The Devolution of Craft
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Algorithimia app colorizes your B&W photos. Apple given patent for disabling iPhone camera at concerts and sensitive sites. Plus DJI introduces updated Geofencing. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests David duChemin and Martin Bailey.

episodes.title: 473: Fujifilm X-T2 - Evolution of a Good Thing
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Fuji releases the X-T2 with cool new features and 4K video capability. Ricoh buys Eyefi Cloud. Plus an update on 500px. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Nicole Young and Evgeny Tchebotarev.

episodes.title: 472: Defending Polycamory
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Recorded live at the Out of Chicago Conference, Frederick and an esteemed panel of experts discuss the business of photography. Join Frederick and his guests Scott Bourne, Derrick Story, Ron Pepper, Valerie Jardin, Rob Knight and Steve Brokaw.

episodes.title: 471: A New Photoshop Arrives!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe rolls out Photoshop 2015.5. More details on the Hasselblad X1D. Plus the FAA issues the first round of rules for drone pilots. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Lee Herbet and Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 470: Virtual Facebook
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Facebook is closer to bringing VR to the masses. iPhone and iPad will shoot RAW photos with iOS 10. Plus gear news from DxO, Hasselblad and Pentax. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Juan Pons and Mike “Sharky” James.

episodes.title: 469: This Week in Apple
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple announcements from WWDC 2016. Plus a Kickstarter project hopes to bring Mercury, the world’s first universal camera, to market. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Dan Ablan.

episodes.title: 468: Ghost in the Machine
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Roll app finds the best photos on your phone. Roxor 4K Gimbal camera costs only $199. Plus Google’s ArtCamera captures every paint stroke in famous masterworks. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Juan Pons, Brian Fischer and Aaron Nace.

episodes.title: 467: The Joy of Failure
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photographers reveal their most valuable mistakes. Plus Adobe brings content aware crop to Photoshop. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Ibarionex Perello and Dave Dugdale.

episodes.title: 466: Modularity By Design - Divide and Conquer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Craft Camera’s new modular 4K system. Google’s Project Ara proves LG was right about modular phones. Instagram’s new icon, app and testing profiles. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Tim Engle and Mike “Sharky” James.

episodes.title: 465: Enter the Matrix
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google unveils Tilt Brush, an app for painting in 3D. Calvin Klein’s upskirt controversy. And DJI’s Matrice 600. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Christine Alward and Brian Fischer.

episodes.title: 464: Future to the Back
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Leica’s latest $6K camera drops the built-in display for a retro look. Who will buy it? And Sony is developing a smart contact lens that does more than let you see. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Jose Rosado and Martin Bailey.

episodes.title: 463: Oh, Baby, I Like It Raw!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: ON1 Photo unveils Photo RAW. Plus a discussion on giving away RAW files. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Sara France, Don Komarechka and Matt Kloskowski.

episodes.title: 462: Get Real!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A photographer claims Calvin Klein stole his work for an ad campaign. The Pictar brings SLR controls to most iPhones. And a patent shows how Apple could add optical zoom to the iPhone. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Juan Pons and Shiv Verma.

episodes.title: 461: A 360° Look at 360° Video
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: GoPro focuses on Omni VR rig. Nikon’s all-seeing 360 degree action camera. And scientists use DNA to store and retrieve photographs. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Mike “Sharky” James.

episodes.title: 460: Lytro’s Multidimensional 40K Cinema Camera
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Will Lytro’s 755MP cinema light field camera kill the green screen? Plus DJI live streams a Phantom 4 drone with Facebook’s new API! Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Chris Berry and Joseph Linaschke.

episodes.title: 459: AlphaMirrorless Arrives!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Frederick Van Johnson welcomes Andy Williams and Juan Pons, hosts of the new show AlphaMirrorless on the TWiP Network, to discuss the differences between Sony’s lack of a touchscreen, the various A7 models, lens options, and much more.

episodes.title: 458: The Ugly Truth
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google offers the Nik Collection of software for free. A discussion about photographing the horrors of modern day terrorism. Plus Adobe introduces Lightroom technology previews and search on the web. This week’s guests: Jeffrey Totaro and Doug Kaye.

episodes.title: 457: Chasing Color
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Instagram switches its feed from chronological to best posts first. Apple announces new hardware devices, accessories and app updates. And David Hobby calls Magbeam's claims BS. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Aaron Nace and Shiv Verma.

episodes.title: 456: Please Shoot Responsibly
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Local landmark shipwreck in California is destroyed for an Instagram photo. Flickr's Auto-Uploader is now a pro-only feature. Plus could the FBI force us to turn on our phone cameras to spy on us? This week’s guests: Derrick Story and Don Komerechka.

episodes.title: 455: A WPPI 2016 Round Up
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Frederick discusses wedding and portrait photography with industry experts Sara France, Bruce Clarke, Craig Colvin, Joseph Linaschke and TWiP veteran Scott Bourne, at the WPPI conference.

episodes.title: 454: All Shiny and Chrome
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DxO One announces new SW updates and a lower price. DJI offers crash insurance for Drones. Eric Chang on the DJI Phantom 4. And a photographer gets kicked off a Toronto beach because of his gear! This week’s guests: Joseph Linaschke and Giulio Sciorio.

episodes.title: 453: Hot New DSLRs!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Pentax K-1 has features not found in other dSLRs. And Canon announces the 80D, along with some new glass and accessories. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Shiv Verma and Tim Engle.

episodes.title: 452: The Constant of Change
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google shuts down Picasa while Google Glass goes dark. Kelby Media lays off big names to focus on core principles. And a photographer sells a photo of a potato...for 1.5 Million! Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Lee Herbet and Martin Bailey.

episodes.title: 451: New Gear from Canon and Sony
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon announces the 1DX Mark II. Sony introduces the a6300 and G Master Lenses. Plus Backblaze will now loan you a hard drive full of your data. Join guest host Bruce Clarke his guests Sara France and Derrick Story.

episodes.title: 450: How to Damage Your Credibility
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon awards prize to badly Photoshopped photo. Dual camera iPhone 7 Plus may offer dSLR-like quality and 3D depth mapping. And Olympus aims at street shooters with the new Pen-F. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Valerie Jardin and Doug Kaye.

episodes.title: 449: Presets - Good, Bad or Lazy?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Bill Gates sells Corbis Images to Visual China Group. Canon's latest creative experiment is...weird. And a round-table discussion on preset systems. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Alex Lindsay.

episodes.title: 448: Fujifilm's X-Factor
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Fuji announces the X-Pro2 and E-ES2. GoPro slashes 7% of its workforce after action camera sales drop. Plus, is celebrity photographer Tyler Shields inspired by...or copying other artists? This week’s guests: Don Komarechka and Lee Herbet.

episodes.title: 447: CES 2016 Round Up
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photography-related announcements from CES. Plus Kodak is set to bring back the Super 8. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Giulio Sciorio and Evgeny Tchebotarev.

episodes.title: 446: France Bans Skinny
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: France outlaws too-thin fashion models and demands that Photoshopping be labeled. CES teasers. And DJI opens a flagship store in Shenzen, China. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Joseph Linaschke and Dave Dugdale.

episodes.title: 445: Travel Hacks from Pro Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A round-table discussion on things the panel has learned when packing for photography trips. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Shiv Verma and Valerie Jardin.

episodes.title: 444: Drone Registration Time!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The FAA officially launches its drone registration program. Google adds shared memories to Google Photos. Plus leaked photo and specs for Nikon's D5. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Matt Granger.

episodes.title: 443: Happy Holiday Photos
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Tips on photographing your family during the holidays. iOS 9.2 lets you import photos to an iPhone directly from your camera. And the 2016 Pirelli calendar breaks tradition and stereotypes. Join Jenny Stein and her guests Lee Herbet and Erika Thornes.

episodes.title: 442: Is VR Poised to Change the World?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe adds significant new features to Photoshop. Phase One acquires Mamiya. And is Virtual Reality ready for its close-up? Join guest host Martin Bailey and his guests Jeffrey Totaro and Bryan Caporicci.

episodes.title: 441: It's a Gray Area
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Is Samsung pulling out of the camera business? Canon sues gray market dealers. Leica's newest camera targets the big guns of the photo world. And more thoughts on Panasonic's Post Focus tech. Join Joseph Linaschke and his guests Lee Herbet and Shiv Verma

episodes.title: 440: Reuters Hates Raw
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Reuters issues a ban on Raw images. A Panasonic firmware update adds Lytro-like focus functionality. And activists at the University of Missouri block journalists from covering the story. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guest Doug Kaye.

episodes.title: 439: Ok Do This
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Model Mayhem becomes more reliable with verified credits. Eye-Fi acquires OKDOTHIS and enters the world of photo-sharing apps. And Hasselblad and DJI form a strategic partnership. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 438: Overexposing Instagram
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Former Instagram model edits photos to reveal truth. B&H worker safety and discrimination allegations. 21st Century Fox takes over National Geographic magazine laying off 180. This week’s guests: Valerie Jardin, Derrick Story and Eric Cheng.

episodes.title: 437: Canon - Waiting to Exhale?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon announces its Q3 financials. YouTube Red's impact on content creators. And VSCO Cam releases a new GIF application called DSCO. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Christine Alward and Tim Engle.

episodes.title: 436: Refugee Camera Systems
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photoplus Expo news round-up. A discussion about memory cards. And hands-on with the Lensbaby Composer Pro II and Edge 50. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Dan Ablan and Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 435: Straight Outta Washington
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The US government plans drone registry. Adobe apologizes for Lightroom 6.2 update and brings back old Import tool. And the NPPA sues the state of Wyoming for threatening photographers rights. This week’s guests: Evgeny Tchebotarev and Nicole Young.

episodes.title: 434: Photography, Evolved
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DJI introduces Osmo, a robotic camera. Is the new Light L16 the future of photography? And a Swiss TV station replaces cameras with iPhones and Selfie sticks. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Sara France and Syl Arena.

episodes.title: 433: Death by Selfie
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Selfies cause more deaths than shark attacks. Adobe unveils 2 new mobile apps and updates to desktop apps at Adobe MAX. Plus a Singapore startup wants to bring astrophotography to the masses. This week’s guests: Martin Bailey and Shiv Verma.

episodes.title: 432: Facebook Gets Virtually Real
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Facebook launches 360 degree videos with new Star Wars Trailer. Sony announces it's low-light beast - the a7S II. And PETA sues a photographer on a monkey's behalf to give the monkey...a copyright. This week’s guests: Don Komarechka and Doug Kaye.

episodes.title: 431: Drones - For Fun and Profit
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DJI announces 2 new mirrorless Micro 4/3 cameras for arial photography. Is Canon pushing things too far with their 120MP SLR? And forget Selfies. The latest holiday accessory is a pro photographer. This week’s guests: Nicole Young and Lee Herbet.

episodes.title: 430: iPad Pro for Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple announces the iPad Pro with an Apple pencil, the iPhone6s and the iPhone6s Plus. And Adobe demos 3 mobile apps coming in October. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Juan Pons and Dan Ablan.

episodes.title: 429: Personal Projects Demystified
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A discussion on how to demystify personal projects. A new service called Agree aims to take the pain out of photography contracts. Plus TWiP is a participant in this year's 5DayDeal! This week’s guests: Lindsay Adler and Giulio Sciorio.

episodes.title: 428: Paranoia and Natural Selection
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Pictage shuts its doors on September 27th, 2015. Instagram goes rectangular! And lastly DxOMark gives its highest rating ever to the Sony A7R II. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Craig Colvin.

episodes.title: 427: Life Sucking Photographer Beliefs
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: 10 life sucking beliefs for photographers. Apple offers free camera replacements for some iPhone 6 Plus units. Plus the death of Pictage. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Sly Arena and Cheryl Dorskind.

episodes.title: 426: APS-C or APS See Ya?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Is Sony sounding the death knell for its APS-C line? Canon introduces the ME20F-SH, a full-frame, 35mm camera that can see in the dark. And Fuji goes infrared. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Sean Bagshaw and Joseph Linaschke.

episodes.title: 425: Not Your Grandfather's Drone
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Flickr brings back Pro accounts. DJI's newest quadcopter, the Phantom 3. Plus a technique discussion about focus stacking. Join Joseph Linaschke and his guests Don Komarechka and Valerie Jardin.

episodes.title: 424: Inside The Everyday Messenger
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Frederick sits down with photographer Trey Ratcliff to discuss the phenomenal Kickstarter campaign and collaboration process for The Everyday Messenger bag.

episodes.title: 423: Learning Photography - Paper vs Pixels
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A discussion on the state of publishing for photographers. Is modern photography education failing its' students? And a roundup of learning resources for photographers. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Rick Sammon and Darlene Hildebrandt.

episodes.title: 422: Google Photos, Mirrorless and Kickstarter PTSD
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google Photos insights. Panasonic announces the GX8. And E1 aims to be the world's smallest micro 4/3 4K camera. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Lee Herbet, Evgeny Tchebotarev and Jefferson Graham.

episodes.title: 421: GoPro, AstroPad and the White House
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: GoPro reinvents its action camera with the GoPro Hero 4 Session. Transform your iPad into a graphics tablet with AstroPad. And the White House lifts its 40-year-long ban on photography. This week’s guests: Martin Bailey and Doug Kaye.

episodes.title: 420: Fashion and the Northern Lights
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special show featuring interviews with Aurora Borealis photographer Ronn Murray and fashion photographer Steve Brokaw.

episodes.title: 419: Creative Cloud 2015
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe launches Creative Cloud 2015...and gets into the stock market with Adobe Stock. Plus a photographer calls out Taylor Swift for hypocrisy over a photography contract. This week’s guests: Don Komarechka, Cheryl Machat Dorskind and Jenny Stein.

episodes.title: 418: Facebook Moments
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Facebook announces new Moments app. A new site makes it easier to review photo sharing sites Terms of Service. Plus DxO launches the DxO One. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Andy Biggs, Valerie Jardin and Juan Pons.

episodes.title: 417: The Sony Onslaught Continues
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sony announces the a7R II and updates to their advanced compacts. Plus soon your favorite carry-on may be too big to fly! Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Bruce Clarke.

episodes.title: 416: There's an App for That!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The team behind Camera+ launches a new video app called Vee. Buy buttons are coming to Pinterest and Instagram. And teaching a dog new pics. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Lisa Bettany and Lee Herbet.

episodes.title: 415: Google Photos and the Paranoia of Free
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google announces Google Photos. Plus Google Jump 360...a virtual reality rig with 16 GoPro cameras. And an artist sells other people's Instagram photos for 100 thousand dollars! This week’s guests: Ibarionex Perello and Derrick Story.

episodes.title: 414: The State of Photojournalism
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A roundtable discussion on the state of photojournalism. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests J.M. Giordano, Sait Serkan Gurbuz, Audrey Gatewood and Matt Roth.

episodes.title: 413: Autonomous Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Lily...the new throw and shoot camera is revealed. Canon updates the Nifty Fifty. And Wolfram launches a new image identification website. Join Rob Knight, sitting in for Frederick Van Johnson, and his guests Darlene Hildebrandt and Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 412: The ArtOfficial Photographer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The dawn of the artofficial photographer. Flickr has new tools with AI. Camera51 Android app comes to iOS. Is the Kodak moment over? We interview Brooks Institute's President: Dr. Tim Gramling. Our guests: Bryan Caporicci, Valerie Jardin and Rob Knight.

episodes.title: 411: Gray in Black and White
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: TWiP guest Joe Giordano is abused by Baltimore police while covering the protests and riot. Is the Apple watch a photographer's best friend? Photofocus' Doug Daulton thinks so. This week’s guests: Martin Bailey, Jeffrey Totaro and J.M. Giordano.

episodes.title: 410: Lightroom CC
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Lightroom CC is released. And a speculative look inside Apple's future iPhone super camera. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Bryan Caporicci and Andy Biggs.

episodes.title: 409: Snapseed, the Best Mobile Photography App?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Snapseed releases a major update with some revolutionary new features. Lensbaby announces a new manual focus lens...the Velvet 56. Plus a new online photo editing tool called Polarr. This week’s guests: Derrick Story and j.m. Giordano.

episodes.title: 408: The DJI Phantom 3 and Apple Photos
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DJI Phantom 3 with 4K video. Canon XC10 Camcorder for shooting 4K video and stills. Apple releases Photos and the Cloud Photo Library. LinkedIn buys Lynda.com for 1.5 billion dollars! Our guests: Joseph Linaschke, Thomas Hawk, and Evegeny Tchebotarev.

episodes.title: 407: Something New from Nikon
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon’s 1 J5 new mirrorless camera, featuring 4K video…kind of. Novo offers first lens filter to feature super-hard gorilla glass and sapphire crystal glass. And we discuss the current state of video tools. Join our guests: Lee Herbet and Martin Bailey.

episodes.title: 406: I Villain, I Photographer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Priime debuts new mobile photo editing application. Arkansas passes privacy legislation that could kill street photography. Amazon introduces unlimited photo storage for only 12 dollars per year. This week’s guests: Michael Willems and Ibarionex Perellon.

episodes.title: 405: The Paradox of Choice
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Gear Avoidance Syndrome, another kind of GAS, and why it might be good for your photography. Nikon thinks your hot shoe needs sprucing up. And are photographers sleepwalking into photographic Armageddon? This week’s guests: Syl Arena and Valerie Jardin

episodes.title: 404: Port Not Found
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple announces a new MacBook with a USB Type C connector. Google introduces Nearline, a new cloud storage solution. And from SXSW comes Meerkat, an app for streaming video over Twitter. This week’s guests: Doug Kaye and Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 403: Google Plus Divides
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google is breaking up Google Plus into Photos, Hangouts and Streams. Profoto launches the B2. Plus Lytro reorganizes and refocuses on virtual reality. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Craig Colvin, Jan Kabili and Alex Koloskov.

episodes.title: 402: The Wedding and Portrait Photographers International Conference
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A TWiP gathering at the WPPI conference discussing highlights of it all and the current state of the wedding photography business. This week’s guests: Bryan Capporicci, Bruce Clarke, Robert Evans, Darlene Hildebrandt, Joseph Linaschke and William Innes.

episodes.title: 401: Photoshop Turns 25!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The Ansel Adams Act goes to Congress. PetaPixel posts a Lightroom 6 leak. How Peter Lik sold close to a half billion dollars in prints. Plus Photoshop turns 25 years old. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Derrick Story and Syl Arena.

episodes.title: 400: The Expendables
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Original cast back for our 400th show! Google plans for a modular camera system. FAA releases draft for drone regulations. And Affinity Photo: a free alternative to Photoshop. This week’s guests: Alex Lindsay, Ron Brinkmann, Aaron Mahler and Steve Simon.

episodes.title: 399: Apple's Photos App Revealed
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: First impressions of Apple's new Photos app. Plus Canon announces two new 50 megapixel beasts. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Nicole Young, Don Komarechka, Joseph Linaschke and Derrick Story.

episodes.title: 398: Raiders of the Lost Art
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: In this episode, we tackle the hot question...is photography art and are photographers artists? Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Renee Robyn, Shiv Verma and Ibarionex Perello.

episodes.title: 397: White House Drone
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Someone crash lands a DJI Quadcopter on President Obama's front lawn. Plus Sports Illustrated lays off its remaining staff photographers. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Syl Arena, Cheryl Machat Dorskind, Joseph Linaschke and Giulio Sciorio.

episodes.title: 396: Market Your Image Theft
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: If you don't want your work stolen, don't post it online. Apple patent approval sends GoPro stock sliding. And changes coming to Sony's PlayMemories Online service are definitely worth a PSA listen. Join host Joseph Linaschke and his guest Martin Bailey.

episodes.title: 395: The Model Citizen
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Lackluster product announcements from the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas. Plus a photographer is sued by a model for inappropriate image use. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Derrick Story and Lucas Passmore.

episodes.title: 394: Wearable? Or Unbearable?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Is 2015 the year of wearable tech? Plus a French newspaper removes all images in support of photographers. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Valerie Jardin and Alex Lindsay.

episodes.title: 393: Is Photography Art?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: When is art, not art? Giving up on stock photography. Plus Frederick and his guests, Nicole Young and Brian Matiash, share their picks of the year.

episodes.title: 392: The Fashion Episode
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: It’s a special holiday episode focused on the facets of fashion photography. Three interviews with the photographer, the model and the studio to keep you busy over the holiday weekend. This week’s guests: Lucas Passmore, Ali Stepka and Jeff Christensen.

episodes.title: 391: Instagram's Instagrowth
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Instagram grows larger than Twitter. Adobe drops 800 Million to buy Fotolia. And Flickr takes some heat for profiting on Creative Commons licensed images. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Joseph Linaschke and Darlene Hildebrandt.

episodes.title: 390: TWiP's Holiday Gift Guide
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Holiday gift ideas for photographers. Plus BitTorrent Sync offers a free solution to backup your photos. Join Frederick Van Johnson and his guests Martin Bailey and Jeffrey Totaro.

episodes.title: 389: The Empire Strikes Back...Again!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sony announces the A7II with 5-axis image stabilization. Adobe reveals more details on a streaming version of Photoshop. And rumor has it, GoPro will start selling drones in 2015. This week’s guests: Valerie Jardin and Evgeny Tchebotarev.

episodes.title: 388: Inside the Candid Frame
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special interview with veteran photography podcaster Ibarionex Perello.

episodes.title: 387: DJI Gets Inspired
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DJI releases the next generation Inspire 1. Skypixel.com looks to be the 500px of Aerial photos. Plus Kiera Knightly says digital shooters aren't as connected to their subjects as film shooters. This week’s guests: Syl Arena & Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 386: What's Up With Nikon and Canon?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Are Pros really ditching Nikon and Canon for mirrorless cameras...or is it just hype? Amazon offers unlimited photo storage for Prime members. And Lytro offers access to its Light Field technology for twenty thousand dollars.

episodes.title: 385: Where the Party At?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A PhotoPlus Expo recap. Mylio offers a new way to organize and access all of your photos. Pixelmator comes to the iPad. And a discussion about Ello and social networking for photographers.

episodes.title: 384: Behind the Seen
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: It's a special topic episode about staying inspired and planning for a creative shoot.

episodes.title: 383: iMac 5K - Bigger, Better, Stronger, Faster
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple updates the iPad and announces a new iMac that features a 5K display. And Adobe releases a free tool to migrate from Aperture to Lightroom.

episodes.title: 382: Ello, Anyone There?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Is Ello just the latest shiny thing for photographers...or the next big social network? Go-Pro adds 4k to its popular action cameras.

episodes.title: 381: The Definitive Guide to Photo Storage
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: In this special round table episode of TWiP, we discuss image backup and archiving. Industry experts Don Komerechka, Topher Martini and Doug Kaye join Frederick Van Johnson to help remove some of the mystery around keeping your precious photos safe.

episodes.title: 380: The Elements of Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photographing on Federal wild lands. Do you have to pay? Adobe announces Photoshop Elements and Premiere Elements 13. The software is targeted for consumers at only 100 dollars each…but could this be enough for most folks?

episodes.title: 379: YOLO!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple's iOS 8 replaces iPhoto with a Photos app…but there's a catch. Panasonic announces the Lumix CM1 smartphone. Twitpic is shutting down while a new service named Tiiny is starting up.

episodes.title: 378: Apple Announces the iPhone 6
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: TWiP gets a brand new website. Apple announces the iPhone 6, the 6 Plus and the iWatch. Nikon announces the D750 and SB-500. While Canon reveals the 7D Mark II. And Panasonic updates the GH4 software with some killer new features.

episodes.title: 377: Sony, Instagram and iStock Photo
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sony brings E-Mount lenses to smartphones. A photographer captures reactions of subjects getting hit with a stun gun. Instagram releases Hyperlapse. And big changes are coming to iStock.

episodes.title: 376: The Bokeh Discussion
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Frederick sits down with the team behind the feature film Bokeh for a discussion about funding with a Kickstarter campaign, shooting on location in Iceland, logistics and more.

episodes.title: 375: Shooting More With Less
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A look at how photos taken with expensive gear can be recreated on the cheap. Sony debuts the new a5100. And Hasselblad's H5D-200c produces 200 megapixel files.

episodes.title: 374: Breaking All the Rules
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon settles a D600 class action law suit. Music artists who don't like having their photographs taken. Plus Manchester United bans iPads and tablets from their stadium.

episodes.title: 373: Monkey Business
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: When a monkey takes a photo, who owns it? Adam Carolla won't let a podcast patent troll drop their suit against him. A New Zealand newspaper uses a Facebook photo without permission...and it's the wrong photo!

episodes.title: 372: A Plethora of Pixels
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Flickr announces a new licensing experience. Is Google planning to separate Google Plus Photos from its social network site? And Zach Arias takes a real world look at the crop versus full frame sensor debate.

episodes.title: 371: Reddit Regret
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A photographer blogs about the negative side of Reddit fame. Hasselblad breaths new life into its analog V-System cameras going back to 1957. And a high speed camera trigger that can be controlled by your smartphone.

episodes.title: 370: No Place to Hide
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The US Constitution's 4th Amendment does not protect online storage. Canon and Microsoft sign a patent agreement. And smartphone photography has doubled restaurant table time.

episodes.title: 369: Plagiarism and the Photographer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A Kickstarter project hopes to revitalize the digital photo frame. Photographer Doug Gordon is in hot water for plagiarism again. And a look at images shot from Sony's new curved sensor.

episodes.title: 368: The Future of Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Smart Glass could transform smartphone cameras. Shutter, a new IOS app, offers unlimited cloud storage...for free. And a discussion about the future of photography.

episodes.title: 367: Apple Stop Downs Aperture
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple ceases development of its Aperture software. Google adds nondestructive editing to Google Plus photos. Nikon announces the D810. And a discussion about travel photography with Ralph Velasco.

episodes.title: 366: Adobe and Amazon Bring It
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe announces changes to its Creative Cloud. Yahoo removes Facebook and Google logins from Flickr. Amazon announces the Fire phone. And an interview direct from Paris, France with Serge Ramelli and Valerie Jardin.

episodes.title: 365: 4K Ought to Be Enough for Anybody
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Giulio Sciorio and Dave Dugdale join Joseph Linaschke to discuss Canon opening up its cloud-based service Irista to the public. Instagram rolls out new features. And what 4K really means for photographers.

episodes.title: 364: Apple’s iCloud Photo Library
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: News from Apple’s WWDC. A Utah high school alters its yearbook photos to make girls appear more modest. Plus an update to Adobe’s Creative Cloud allows users to run older versions of the company’s apps.

episodes.title: 363: Time to Fling the Poo!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Martin Bailey and Don Komarechka discuss Nikon stock hitting a 3 year low. The Camera Store pits 4 mirrorless cameras against the Nikon D4s. A Facebook engineer posts a guide on how to steal graduation photos. Plus an interview with Renee Robyn.

episodes.title: 362: GoPro Goes IPO!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: GoPro plans its IPO. Search by gender affinity on 500px Prime. The FCC backs fast lanes for web traffic. And an interview with Google Plus Photos Brian Matiash.

episodes.title: 361: Amazon Your Blurb
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Guest Host Joseph Linaschke, Craig Colvin and Jeffrey Totaro discuss Amazon's new partnership with Blurb, curating automated photography, and Wal-Mart suing a photographer's widow for copyright violation.

episodes.title: 360: Amazon Patents the Unpatentable
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Dan Ablan and Martin Bailey join Frederick to discuss Getty's Photo.com. And Amazon gets a patent on a common studio photography technique.

episodes.title: 359: Google Plus Subtracts
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sara France and Nate Burr, a.k.a. Blunty, join Frederick to talk about the big changes over at Google Plus. Also a discussion about Imagenomic who just updated its popular portraiture retouching plug-in to handle video.

episodes.title: 358: Leica Jumps into the Mirrorless Pool.
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Leica jumps into the mirrorless pool. Lytro introduces the Illum. A photographer pleads guilty to violating the Endangered Species Act. Listener Q and A. Plus our Picks of the Week.

episodes.title: 357: The Visual Imagination
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Flickr redesigns their mobile app and adds video capture. Google brings Lytro-like functionality to Android devices. Eye-Fi launches a new cloud service. And an interview with David duChemin of Craft and Vision.

episodes.title: 356: Canon Gets Schooled
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Dropbox launches Carousel. Canon undercutting professional photographers with discount photography sessions. Lensbaby turns to Kickstarter to fund a new lens for the iPhone. Plus listener Q and A and Picks of the Week.

episodes.title: 355: Lightroom Goes Mobile
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Lightroom goes mobile. Sony reveals the A7s. Canon charging customers to repair known issues with the 1D X. Plus Listener Q and A and Picks of the Week.

episodes.title: 354: Punishing Negative Reviewers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photographers suing clients for bad reviews. Photos taken in Hungary w/o permission now illegal. A photographer wins 1.2 million dollars over photos taken from social media. And we interview Amanda Eddy, Public Relations Manager for Photodex.

episodes.title: 353: TWiP Live with Panasonic!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special episode of TWiP recorded live on the show floor of WPPI in the Panasonic booth featuring Guilio Sciorio, William Innes and Kristen Jensen. Plus an interview on travel photography with Ralph Velasco.

episodes.title: 352: The Jedi Mind Trick
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon announces the Nikon 1 V3. Instagram and product placement. Drone pilots are flying high again. Photography retailer Calumet closes its doors in the United States. And an interview with Panasonic luminary Rob Knight.

episodes.title: 351: Stock! In the Name of Love
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Getty Images makes much of its portfolio free to use. A photographer makes 15,000 dollars on Instagram in 1 day. iStock Photo introduces a subscription model. 500px Prime goes live. Plus an interview with Sports Illustrated photographer Peter Read Miller.

episodes.title: 350: Can You Photoshop That?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A photographer’s 7000 dollars worth of gear left on a Japanese bullet train is all returned! Ellen's Oscar selfie: most retweeted photo ever. Jezebel offers 10K for unretouched images of Lena Dunham in Vogue. And we interview Mark Homza, CMO of Flixel.

episodes.title: 349: Nikon Introduces a New Flagship DSLR?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon announces the D4S. Is Canon pulling out of the cheap point-and-shoot market? Problems over at PocketWizard. Plus an interview with nature photographer Juan Pons.

episodes.title: 348: What's In a (Domain) Name?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: New domains for photographers including .photography and .camera. The Color Run sues a photographer. Photo buyers, photo stealers and Facebook jealousy. Plus an interview with YouTube star Blunty.

episodes.title: 347: Nikon, Panasonic, Pentax and Sony
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: New hardware from Nikon, Panasonic, Pentax and Sony. Adobe's Principal Product Manager John Nack joins Google's digital photography team. Layoffs and restructuring at Sony. Plus an interview with portrait photographer Peter Hurley.

episodes.title: 346: Punishing a Pixel Pusher
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A Pulitzer Prize-winning Associated Press photographer is fired for cloning. The JPEG Standard goes lossless. Hasselblad announces a twelve thousand dollar DSLR. Plus an interview with photographers Jay and Varina Patel, Brent Mail and Johny Spencer.

episodes.title: 345: An Interview with Bryan Caporicci
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An interview with photographer and entrepreneur Bryan Caporicci who discusses the business of photography and shooting with a purpose. Plus Bryan’s take on whether it’s possible to create pro-quality work with small mirrorless cameras.

episodes.title: 344: The Return of Syl Arena
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe adds new features to Photoshop CC. Is the Japanese camera market in jeopardy? Switching brand allegiances. Plus an interview with Scott Braut and Keren Sachs of Shutterstock.com.

episodes.title: 343: Image Rights and Wrongs
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google presents rights filtered image search options. Joe McNally starts off 2014 with a one dollar and thirty-two cent royalty check. Instant plagiarized portfolio sites. Plus an interview with Pulitzer Prize-winning photographer Brian Smith.

episodes.title: 342: How Very Selfie of You
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: New gear from Fuji announced in advance of CES. Announcements from Canon, Nikon and Sony at CES. The rise and fall of the selfie. And an interview with commercial and fine-arts photographer Bob Coates.

episodes.title: 341: Theft vs. Creative Inspirations
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special New Year’s show about theft vs. creative inspiration with Rick Sammon.

episodes.title: 340: Peter Krogh on Managing Lightroom Libraries
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special holiday episode with photo management guru Peter Krogh. It's an in-depth sit-down discussion on how to effectively manage your growing Lightroom library.

episodes.title: 339: Best Photography Tech Trends of 2013
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photography technology trends of 2013. Plus an interview with photographer Shiv Verma.

episodes.title: 338: Holiday Gifts for Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The Chicago Sun Times rehires some of the photographers they replaced with iPhone reporters. Nikon's firmware update kills some third-party batteries. TWiP's holiday gift-giving guide. And an interview with Steve Brokaw.

episodes.title: 337: The Evolving Art of Portraiture
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Derrick Story and Lindsay Adler join Frederick for an in-depth discussion on the evolving art of portraiture. Plus an interview with New York City boudoir photographer Christa Meola.

episodes.title: 336: An Interview with Karen Hutton
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: It's a special holiday interview with photographer and voice-over artist Karen Hutton.

episodes.title: 335: How To Get the Perfect Shot
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: When disaster strikes, photojournalism stands tall. Getting the perfect shot. Flickr jumps into book publishing. And an interview with Jared Bauman of ShootDotEdit.

episodes.title: 334: The Future of Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple and Google. Two different models for the future of photography. Plus the plight of photojournalism. And an interview with supermodel turned photographer Kristen Jensen.

episodes.title: 333: If It Feels Good, Shoot It!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A discussion on Sony's A7 and A7r mirrorless, Panasonic's Lumix GM1, Nikon's new retro Df, Apple's OS X Mavericks, iOS 7, and the faster, lighter iPads. Plus an interview with Camera Labs.com mastermind Gordon Laing's thoughts on the Sony A7 and A7r.

episodes.title: 332: Smartphone Creep
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon's financial forecast is haunted by smartphone creep. Adobe hack affects 38 million people. A roundtable discussion about learning photography. Plus Don Komarechka inspires you to kick start your photographic dreams.

episodes.title: 331: Travel Tips for Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: It's a very special interview show with landscape, nature and travel photographers Jay and Varina Patel.

episodes.title: 330: Sweet and Sour Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: It's sweet and sour photography. An online petition causes 2 photographers to pull out of speaking at WPPI. Leaked shots of Sony's new mirrorless camera surface. Plus an interview with model Tor Alexander.

episodes.title: 329: Innovation, Inspiration and Hacking
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon releases the D610. Pentax introduces the K-3. Instagram adds advertisements. Adobe gets hacked. Plus an interview on finding your inspiration with LA-based photographer Brooke Shaden.

episodes.title: 328: Learning Light
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon files a patent for an interchangeable sensor camera. A priest stops a wedding ceremony to scold a photographer. A round table discussion on learning light. Plus an interview with marketing expert Nathan Morris.

episodes.title: 327: Going Postal
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The United States Postal Service pays 685,000 dollars for copyright infringement. Plus Nikon introduces the AW1, a waterproof, freezeproof and shockproof mirrorless camera. And a USA Today sports photographer gets caught faking an important shot.

episodes.title: 326: The Evolution of Image Editing
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A look at Facebook's revised privacy policy. Google Plus releases new photo editing tools. Are Nikon and Canon entering the medium format market? Plus an interview with PhotoShelter CEO Andrew Fingerman.

episodes.title: 325: Ron Brinkmann Gets Engaged!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Olympus releases the OMD EM1. Apple unveils the iPhone 5S and 5C. Sigma's new camera Mount Conversion Service. Plus an interview with the Godfather Mr. Rick Sammon.

episodes.title: 324: From Dream to Reality
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Alex Lindsay explains why Goggle Glass is so cool. Flickr updates its IOS App. Facebook adds shared photo albums. Also Samsung goes Android on a new camera and Sony intros the Camera List camera. Plus an interview with NYC photographer Vivienne Gucwa.

episodes.title: 323: How to Feed an Elephant
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Facebook and Shutterstock collaborate on stock photography. Reuters says good-bye to its USA sports photographers. Plus operating a studio in Taipei, Taiwan with photographer Garret Clarke.

episodes.title: 322: An Unnatural Obsession
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photographers obsessing over other photographer's gear choices. Rumors of a new Sony Lens Camera. Listener Q and A and our Picks of the Week. Plus an interview with pet photographer Jeff Otto.

episodes.title: 321: Get the Shot!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: How to get the shot when shooting landscape, nature and street photography. Plus an interview with New York City fashion photographer Lindsay Adler.

episodes.title: 320: Reflecting on Mirrorless
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special round table discussion with Mirrorless Mavericks Gordon Laing of CameraLabs.com, Trey Ratcliff of StuckinCustoms.com, Giulio Sciorio of SmallCameraBigPicture.com and Doug Kaye of DougKaye.com.

episodes.title: 319: The Reincarnation of SmugMug
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A photographer is outed for plagiarism. SmugMug reboots and Instagram adds image embedding. Plus an interview with SmugMug's Co-Founder Chris MacAskill.

episodes.title: 318: Brides, Grooms and Roller Coasters
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Wedding and event photographer, Daniel McGarrity, discusses changes in the Industry. Kris Rowberry, the guy behind greatamericanthrills.net, talks about his passion for amusement parks and his quest to document America's healthy obsession with thrills.

episodes.title: 317: Get Off My Cloud!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Your images plus the cloud equals government property? Magic Lantern gives Canon shooters an extra 3 stops of light. Steve Simon is back on TWiP! And Nature and Landscape contest winner Peter Greig joins us to defend and discuss his winning entry.

episodes.title: 316: Goodbye Nikon, Hello Sony
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special interview with Trey Ratcliff of stuckincustoms.com about his recent switch from Nikon DSLR's to Sony Mirrorless Cameras.

episodes.title: 315: Cheap and Easy Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: What's up with liveBooks? The slow devaluation of photography. Canon introduces the 70D. Plus an interview with Severin Matusek of EyeEm.

episodes.title: 314: Phlearning is Phundamental
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Announcing the winner of our Nature and Landscape contest! Plus our newest contest: A Picture is Worth a Thousand Lyrics. Connected Data has given us 2 Transporters to give away! And an interview with Aaron Nace of Phlearn Phame.

episodes.title: 313: Instagram! I like to move it, move it!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Instagram adds video. Associated Press invests in crowdsourced news site Bambuser. A photographer is fatally stabbed in Los Angeles after photographing panhandlers. Plus an interview with professional photographer Michael Freeman.

episodes.title: 312: The Creative Cloud Arrives
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe's Creative Cloud is here. The business of photography contests. Plus instant photography business. Just add dollars! And at the end of the show, an interview with photographer Laura Tillinghast.

episodes.title: 311: Formerly Known as Prints
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple announces an updated photo App, along with some hardware refreshes at their World Wide Developers Conference. Plus the commoditization of selling prints. And an interview with Eye-fi co-founder Ziv Gillat.

episodes.title: 310: The Sun-Times Hates Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The Chicago Sun-Times fires its entire photography staff. A rock band enables photographers to get the shot...for a price. Plus a discussion with Baltimore-based photographer J. M. Giordano.

episodes.title: 309: New Yorkers Exposed
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Some New Yorkers are furious about photos taken thru windows. Mr. Jack Reznicki chimes in on the subject. The beginning of the end for the compact camera. Snapchat photos are not really deleted. And Derrick Story on being a nimble and mobile photographer.

episodes.title: 308: Flickr, 500px and Google Plus
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Flickr gets a controversial refresh. At the Google IO Conference, Google Plus gets a streamlined UI, Snapseed integration, and an upgrade for its Android app. Plus an interview with Evgeny Tchebotarev of 500px.

episodes.title: 307: The Workflow Episode
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The new Olympus PEN E-P5 boasts several impressive features. A discussion about mirrorless photography. Plus a deep dive into post-processing workflows. And an interview with photographer Trey Ratcliff who talks about his workflow.

episodes.title: 306: Cloudy Skies for Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe shifts into the cloud. Adobe also reveals new hardware in the works...the Mighty Pen and Napoleon Ruler. A look into our post-processing workflows. Plus an interview with Manuello Paganelli.

episodes.title: 305: Bringing Sexy Back
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: 100 ground-breaking cameras in the history of photography. New UK legislation that provides unlimited access to orphaned works. And an interview with Craft and Vision's Corwin Hiebert on the business of e-book publishing.

episodes.title: 304: Boston, Banned Cameras, and Beyonce
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The Boston Marathon bombings reinforce the importance of great photojournalism. The Kentucky Derby bans all interchangeable lens cameras. And Beyonce tells pro photographers to look for other work.

episodes.title: 303: Adobe Releases the Lightroom 5 Beta!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe releases the Lightroom 5 Beta. A photographer tracks down a thief using Craigslist. Dove Canada uses a fake Photoshop action to shame overzealous retouchers. And our Critique of the Week segment!

episodes.title: 302: Just Say Cheese
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sears and Walmart shut down their portrait studios. A new app that allows your friends to purchase photos from your Facebook account without your permission. A discussion on how far you might go to get a shot. Plus we interview Varina and Jay Patel.

episodes.title: 301: Fro Goes Wild!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Imitating versus originating. An off-the-rails discussion about all-things photography. Plus an interview with Matt Granger, a.k.a. That Nikon Guy, at the end of the show credits.

episodes.title: 300: This is Sparta!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon's big vision…the small or petite DSLR.  A photographer sues his subject. Saint NIK comes early. And an interview with Jared Polin of FroKnowsPhoto.com.

episodes.title: 299: It's Hip to Shoot Square
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Facebook's facelift. Is it good for photographers? Portland is charging to photograph iconic landmarks. And the FAA grounds a UAV aerial photography business.

episodes.title: 298: Just Say No
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An in-depth discussion about photographers and the law. Plus, an interview with photographer Sara Collaton.

episodes.title: 297: The Oakland Shuffle
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Emerging technologies in smartphone photography. Photojournalists becoming targets for thieves in Oakland, CA. Plus, an interview with Mr. Mike Larson about the state of Wedding Photography.

episodes.title: 296: Game of Drones
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A discussion on Nikon's newest DSLR. We dive into Droneography, the art of doing aerial photography with drones and quadcopters. And is Flickr finally Back? Plus an interview with Aaron Mahler.

episodes.title: 295: Learn Me Something
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The changing landscape of online learning. Twitter launches Vine. Vimeo acquires Echograph. Plus an interview with Darlene Hildebrandt from HerViewPhotography.com.

episodes.title: 294: Inmates Take Over the Asylum
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: iStockPhoto dumps top photographer over Getty Google controversy. Updates on Flickr, Instagram and 500px. A roundtable discussion on cloud solutions for photographers. And an interview with Ryan Stansky from Squarespace.

episodes.title: 293: Triple Play
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Three short interviews with some friends of the show. Chris Orwig on how photographers can develop their individual style. Brian Fischer about the recent Blog World and New Media Expo. And Don Komarechka sets the record straight on Canadian copyright.

episodes.title: 292: The Camera Sutra
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The CP Plus trade show in Japan. Smartphone stock photos. Techniques for choosing your best images. And an interview with David H. Wells.

episodes.title: 291: Image Use and Abuse
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A Judge rules Twitter images are off-limits. Apple's nudity police yank 500px app. Google and Getty stick 5000 royalty-free images in your Google Drive. Plus we interview sports photographers Matt Cohen and Ryu Voelkel of BigLensFastShutter.com.

episodes.title: 290: Canon Gets Physical
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon debuts new Experience Center stores. Google says it knows who the 16 most popular photographers are. Facebook gets into the search business. And an interview with Zenfolio's Ian Stone.

episodes.title: 289: Small Camera Big Picture
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photography goodness from CES. Polaroid to launch retail Fotobar outlets. Art.com acquires Zenfolio. And a discussion with Giulio Sciorio, the guy behind smallcamerabigpicture.com about his move to micro four thirds.

episodes.title: 288: How Photographers Use Social Media
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Instagram's snafu. CES expectations. Photography and publishing in 2013. And an interview with Scott Bourne.

episodes.title: 287: Blurb's Daniel Milnor on Self-Publishing for Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special inbetween-holidays interview with Daniel Milnor of Blurb regarding self-publishing for photographers.

episodes.title: 286: An Evening with SmugMug
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: 2 interviews with photo industry movers and shakers Martin Evening and SmugMug's Chris MacAskill.

episodes.title: 285: Irreconcilable Pixels
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google announces new Communities feature. Reuters' top 95 images of 2012 reveals interesting stats. Is 2013 Sony's year? Instagram breaks ties with Twitter. And the founder of Connected Data, Geoff Barrall, talks about his latest project the Transporter.

episodes.title: 284: Photo Ethics, Facebook and Street Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photo ethics in the Big Apple. Two very different photo tales from New York City. Facebook and Eye-Fi unveil new cloud services. Black Eyed Peas' frontman Will.i.am's iPhone bling. And an interview with street photographer James Maher.

episodes.title: 283: Building creativeLIVE with Chase Jarvis
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A very special one-on-one interview with the one and only Chase Jarvis of creativeLIVE.

episodes.title: 282: How to Build a Social Media Following of 8 Million People
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A very special interview with photographer Trey Ratcliff who gives listeners some insight into how he grew a social media empire that attracted 8 million followers, along with a profitable business that allows him the freedom to pursue his dreams.

episodes.title: 281: O Canada O Copyright
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canadian photographers rejoice over new copyright laws. Tombstone and military homecoming photography new trend. Hurricane Sandy's aftermath for photoshoot backdrop. SmugMug adjusts prices. Bruce Clarke interviews Gerard Murphy of Mosaic Archive.

episodes.title: 280: Instagram Stigmagram
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Instagram, Facebook and Twitter look to add exciting new features. Nikon introduces the D5200. Canon announces 2 new stabilized "L" lenses. And an interview with model Jesse Deol.

episodes.title: 279: iPad Mini for Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: News and announcements from PhotoPlus Expo. Apple and Microsoft announce new hardware and software. Nikon users experiencing dust issues on the D600. Canon profits are down as worldwide camera sales decline. And we interview Photographer Danny Postawa.

episodes.title: 278: The Photographer's Survival Manual
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special interview with copyright attorney Ed Greenberg and photographer, educator and author Jack Reznicki on model releases and legal pitfalls covered in their book "The Photographer's Survival Manual: A Legal Guide for Artists in the Digital Age".

episodes.title: 277: Space Jumps, DNG and Lederhosen
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: 35 cameras used to record Felix Baumgartner's space jump. A round table discussion about Apple's Aperture. And Adobe expands the DNG format.

episodes.title: 276: The End of the DSLR
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Do Nikon's D4 and D800 pass the BBC test? One year after Steve Jobs' passing. Getty Images celebrates its half-millionth image in the Flickr collection. And an interview with Model Mayhem's Brian Diaz and Dean Johnson.

episodes.title: 275: Sony Dating Olympus
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sony becomes the largest shareholder in Olympus. Kodak leaves the consumer printing market. A new App that allows you to take just one photograph…ever. IKEA Saudi Arabia photoshops women out of its catalog. And an interview with Michael Willems.

episodes.title: 274: Lytro Goes Mainstream
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Lytro enters the retail market. Adobe releases Photoshop Elements 11. An update on Nokia's Lumia 920 smartphone and their marketing fiasco. Some takeaways from Photokina 2012. And we interview Brooks Institute of Photography's Professor Ralph Clevenger.

episodes.title: 273: Google Acquires Nik
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: New full-frame bodies from both Canon and Nikon. Google has snapped up Nik software. Sekonic introduces a touch-screen light meter. And Sigma reorganizes its lens lineup and adds USB connectors.

episodes.title: 272: The iPhone5 for Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple releases the iPhone5. Nokia fakes some new technology. A round table discussion about photography plug-ins. And an interview with Adobe's Bryan O'Neil Hughes.

episodes.title: 271: SmugMuggery
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: SmugMug doubles its pro pricing. Focus peaking making its way into more cameras. And an interview with SmugMug's President and Co-Founder Chris MacAskill a.k.a. Baldy.

episodes.title: 270: Apple's Clone Wars
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple beats Samsung. IKEA goes 3D. Sony and Samsung release smart cameras. Photography at the speed of light. And an interview with Matthew Jordan Smith.

episodes.title: 269: Camera Evolution or Intelligent Design?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Who's been stalking your Facebook photos? Nikon and Sony embrace Android. Getty and Pictage change hands. Vogue bans skinny models. Plus an interview with Sue Bryce.

episodes.title: 268: A Happy Medium
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Twitter founders launch a new service called Medium. Canon's T4i rash issue results in a recall. And has Yahoo's Marissa Mayer signed into Flickr? Turns out, no. And an interview with photoshop expert Ben Willmore.

episodes.title: 267: Curiosity the Photographer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Thoughts on Curiosity's Mars landing. Significant firmware updates from Canon and PocketWizard. The Washington D.C. police announce a new cell phone and camera policy. And an interview with Garry Lassman of GoPixIt.com.

episodes.title: 266: Aperture or Lightroom
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Where, oh, where is Aperture 4? Facebook likes the Google Plus photo layout. An update on Olympic photography antics. And an interview with creativeLIVE Senior VP George Varanakis.

episodes.title: 265: Cheap and Easy Digital Escorts
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon enters the mirrorless market. A photographer's Instagram photos get published in Sports Illustrated. And some folks are buying Instagram Followers and Likes.  Plus an interview with Gavin Seim.

episodes.title: 264: Yahoo Googles a CEO
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Yahoo Googles a CEO. Apple readies a Mountain Lion. A discussion about the new Google Plus iPad App. And an interview with Dane Sanders.

episodes.title: 263: An Olympic Photo Finish
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Outrage over bad Olympic portraits. Microsoft reveals the Surface. Are you allergic to your camera? And an interview with Trey Ratcliff.

episodes.title: 262: Interview with Robert Vanelli
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An interview with Robert Vanelli to talk about all things Vanelli. We talk about his first career as a karate world champion. His breakthrough into photography. And his refined 5 Ps of digital workflow.

episodes.title: 261: Interview with Aaron Hockley
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A discussion with photographer Aaron Hockley about how social media can be both a blessing and a curse…and how to avoid that nasty curse part.

episodes.title: 260: Interview with Jeff Carrion
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An interview with Jeff Carrion, Digital Media Specialist for DePaul University in Chicago, regarding how he manages the weekly terabytes of data that over 25,000 students, faculty and other sources create.

episodes.title: 259: A Wider Aperture
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photography news from Apple's World Wide Developers Conference. Canon announces new lenses including a 200 dollar 40mm pancake lens. Leica releases a 50,000 dollar Limited Edition camera. And we discuss whether it's better to specialize or generalize?

episodes.title: 258: Grand Theft Photo
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon set to announce the Rebel T4i. GoPro goes wireless. Nikon files patent for sharper in-camera panning. Why are photographers stealing from other photographers? And an interview with Jeff Dunas from the Palm Springs Photo Festival.

episodes.title: 257: How to Look Like a Photographer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Recapping the Google Plus Conference. Facebook launches its own camera app. Hasselblad lowers the price of medium format. Why are photographers stealing from other photographers? And an interview with Don Komarechka.

episodes.title: 256: Canon and ASMP
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An interview with Eugene Mopsik, Executive Director of the American Association of Media Professionals, ASMP, about photography associations. And Chuck Westfall, from Canon, talks about Canon's DSLR line and what Canon is up to in the video space.

episodes.title: 255: Deliberate Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A new movie made with fifty Canon 1D Mark IIIs. Leica announces an 8,000 dollar, black and white only rangefinder camera. And a discussion on deliberate photography.

episodes.title: 254: The Psychology of Photography
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A deep-dive discussion on the psychology and mindset behind photography. Plus Canon and Nikon issue fixes. The Blackberry time machine. Olympus gets rugged. And an interview with Playboy photographers Arny Freytag and Jarmo Pahjaniemi.

episodes.title: 253: The Retouching Debate
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon and Canon entry-level full-frame dSLRs? Teenager petitions Seventeen to publish non-airbrushed images. Olympics looking to ban photo shares via social networks. IKEA and the camera market. And we interview the founder of GlamourCon: Bob Schultz.

episodes.title: 252: The Adobe Creative Cloud
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe releases Creative Suite 6. Nikon announces the D3200 and new wireless adaptor. And an interview with Megan Anderson on arts and crafts photography.

episodes.title: 251: Leaky Light?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Light leak issues with the 5D Mark III. Canon announces 2 new 4K video DSLRs. A Google Plus conference for photographers. And an interview with Reid Warner from Snapknot about what's new in wedding photography.

episodes.title: 250: Facebook Hearts Instagram
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Facebook acquires Instagram for ONE BILLION dollars! 500px introduces a 20 dollar membership. And an interview with Pixoto co-founder Jason Kiefer.

episodes.title: 249: How the Sausage is Made
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: More layoffs and lawsuits for Yahoo. Instagram available for Android. A round table discussion on monitors for photographers. And an interview with C. J. Chilvers on minimalist photography.

episodes.title: 248: The Sony Re-org and Photoshop CS6
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Sony reorganizes and focuses on digital imaging. The Photoshop CS6 impresses. And an interview on photographer law with Allen Melser.

episodes.title: 247: A Special Canon 5D Mark III Pricing Discussion
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special conversion with Derrick Story of thedigitalstory.com. Derrick has some interesting insights for TWiP listeners regarding the pricing of the Canon 5D Mark III.

episodes.title: 246: Pinterest's Interest
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A deeper look at Pinterest in the interest of photographers. The Daily Mirror steals a photograph to illustrate an article about a serial killer. And an interview with Dan Ablan.

episodes.title: 245: Photoshop, Sony Alpha A57, and the iPad
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe teases about enhancing video in photoshop. Sony announces the new Alpha A57. The new iPad's retina display - bad for photographers? A discussion on making money with photography. And an interview with celebrity photographer Michael Grecco!

episodes.title: 244: Canon 5D Mark III, iPad 3, and Lightroom 4
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon introduces the 5D Mark III…and also incorporates radio into their Speedlites. The iPad 3 is announced with a new iPhoto. And Lightroom 4 is officially released.

episodes.title: 243: Nokia, 500px, and Flickr
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nokia throws down the 41 megapixel gauntlet. 500px and Flickr get make-overs. And Arizona wants to legislate Photoshopped images.

episodes.title: 242: Adobe Gets Content Aware
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
