episodes.summary: Adobe shows off their new CS6 Content Aware move feature. PocketWizard evolves with the Plus III model. And can one man photograph every captive species on earth?

episodes.title: 241: In Deep on Nikon and Adobe
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: In deep with the Nikon D800. Adobe announces the Creative Cloud. 50 dollars for an 'all you can eat Creative Suite.'

episodes.title: 240: The Nikon D800, Facebook IPO, and New Canon Lenses
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Nikon announces the D800. 3,000 Photos are uploaded to Facebook every second. And an interview with Bambi Cantrell.

episodes.title: 239: Sad Times at Canon, Sigma, Kodak, and Yahoo!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon's President steps down. Apple reinvents the eBook with its iBook Author app. And Yahoo! begins axing customer support reps.

episodes.title: 238: Deviantly Artistic
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: We get creatively deviant in a very special interview with Josh Wattles, the Advisor in Chief of DeviantArt.

episodes.title: 237: Bourne To Be Wild
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Scott Bourne joins us with some hands-on Lytro feedback. Photography news from CES 2012. And Adobe back-tracks on its CS6 upgrade pricing policy.

episodes.title: 236: The Fantastic 4's
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe releases the Lightroom 4 public beta. Nikon announces the much anticipated D4. And some Updates from Olympus and Kodak.

episodes.title: 235: Publishing Photography
episodes.author: Alex Lindsay
episodes.summary: Photographers building a book for charity in Goggle Plus. Is Apple planning new publishing tools? And should you send your photos out to be retouched... in India?

episodes.title: 234: 2012 Photographic Resolutions
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Looking back on the trends of 2011. Looking forward on 2012.

episodes.title: 233: An Interview with Vincent LaForet
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DSLR Video Pioneer, Vincent LaForet, discusses shooting commercial projects with cinematic results for a fraction of the cost. How the industry has changed, and what might be next. How to get professional-looking video without taking out a 2nd mortgage.

episodes.title: 232: There's a Yak for That
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: DSLRs banned from a UK tube station because of their resolution?  The iPhone invades stock photography.  Kodak is in the ER.  And rumors of another new memory format ... to replace Compact Flash?

episodes.title: 231: Only 30 Bucks to Touch Their Junk
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: CNN lays off photojournalists saying free is better.  Camera shops begin charging to "touch their junk."  A look back at the most memorable images and stories of 2011.  Plus an Interview with Paul C. Buff of White Lightening and Alien Bees fame.

episodes.title: 230: Flash is Dead. Long Live Flash.
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Are liquid lenses next? Adobe kills Flash for mobile devices, revamps upgrade policy of CS6. Google+ helps find owner of camera lost at sea. Nikon D800 details and SB910 revealed. And we interview Dan Brodnitz of Video2Brain on distance learning.

episodes.title: 229: Photographer Focus
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: During this Thanksgiving Day holiday in the US we have two insightful photographer interviews with Eric Doggett and Ryan Enn Hughes.

episodes.title: 228: Google Loves Photographers
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The camera manufacturer industry is abuzz with big news from Olympus Canon and Red. GooglePlus rolls out Pages. An interview with Photoshop Guru Jeff Schewe.

episodes.title: 227: Glamorous
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: TWiP Special Edition from GlamorCon. Enjoy interviews with 4 talented professionals. Photographers: Mark Daughn. Brent Burzycki. Ariston Collander. Model: Tor Alexander.

episodes.title: 226: Retro Active
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Use your iPhone to scan old family photographs. Nikon eyeing webOS from HP. What's behind the rise in popularity of Retro photography. How important is the printed portfolio.

episodes.title: 225: Air Fresheners on Mount Olympus
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The Olympus story continues to unfold. Getty gets a whiff of some pine scented lawsuit. And, the Thailand floods hinder production at Nikon, Sony, and more.

episodes.title: 224: Canon Olympus and Lytro
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Canon announces the EOS 1DX. Olympus fires its CEO. And Lytro announces its new hardware.

episodes.title: 223: F Cancer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Photoshop on tablets? Haunted ethics? And F cancer!

episodes.title: 222: Farewell Steven Paul Jobs
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Farewell Steve Jobs. Apple rolls out the iPhone 4S. And Adobe announces a touch version of photoshop for Android.

episodes.title: 221: Interview with Katrin Eismann
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Katrin Eismann, internationally recognized artist, author, and educator has been working with digital imaging tools since 1989. She addresses the latest tools and techniques and the impact upon professional photographers, artists, and educators.

episodes.title: 220: The Passionate Photographer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Self-publishing for Photographers. Amazing new cameras from Canon. And an interview with podcasting veteran Martin Bailey.

episodes.title: 219: Interview With Jack Reznicki
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: In this interview Frederick and world-renowned commercial photographer and past president of the Professional Photographers of America (PPA) Jack Reznicki discuss copyright (or copywrong) as it applies and relates to photographers everywhere.

episodes.title: 218: Everything I Say is Wrong
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: New software from Adobe. A new chapter in the Final Cut saga. And a discussion on retro-looking cameras.

episodes.title: 217: Big Things in Small Packages
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Now size DOES matter? An Israeli company develops a smaller Jpeg. Flickr allows a digital fence around your photos. And a lawsuit against Urban Outfitters and their photographer from the parents of a model photographed in a, let's say, adult manner.

episodes.title: 216: You Are Not a Photographer
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A new website tells some photographers...well, they're not. A Pennsylvania photographer bans some Facebook bullies. And UK Tube commuters get photographed without their permission.

episodes.title: 215: Stock It To Me!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Stock buyers or stock shooters? Who's to blame for the current state of the stock industry? Delkin releases CF cards for extreme shooting conditions. And a photo of President Obama at a military memorial service stirs controversy.

episodes.title: 214: Fix It in Post
episodes.author: Alex Lindsay
episodes.summary: Are photographers becoming post-production artists? Controlling your camera with an Android. And shooting kids in public places...it may be legal, but is it cool?

episodes.title: 213: Patent Smurfs
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Kodak selling off billion dollar patents. Future camera technology. And a round table discussion on image back-up strategies.

episodes.title: 212: Regulated Retouching
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Britain censoring airbrushed photos. Facial recognition for backgrounds. And Google Images adds EXIF data.

episodes.title: 211: Off the Wall
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Apple releases the Lion. A photographic Rube Goldberg contraption. And photographer David duChemin talks about his unfortunate accident.

episodes.title: 210: Monkey Business
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Monkeys taking self-portraits. AP gets tough on photo manipulation. And Steve Simon discovers Facebook!

episodes.title: 209: Google Plus, iPhoneography, and FujiFilm
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Google Plus for photographers. Photographing your own heart surgery. And an interview with Photojack, Jack Hollingsworth.

episodes.title: 208: An Interview with Evgeny Tchebotarev
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: A special holiday interview with Evgeny Tchebotarev, Creative Director and Co-Founder of 500px.com.

episodes.title: 207: Final Cut, Google, and Lytro
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Is Apple's Final Cut Pro X designed for photographers? Tennessee outlaws emotionally distressing images.  New Lytro camera lets you shoot first and focus later. And Google rolls out reverse image search.

episodes.title: 206: An Interview with Robert Evans
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Celebrity Wedding Photographer Robert Evans and Frederick sit down (via Skype) to talk about what amazing adventures Robert's been up to, as well as getting into the details about what exactly it takes to "go pro".

episodes.title: 205: Big Brother in Your Camera?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Is Apple going Big Brother with remote camera control patents? NASA takes a Nikon to space…and leaves it there. And are still cameras on their death bed?

episodes.title: 204: iCloud, Twitter, and Nikon
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Rumor and speculation around Apple's iCloud. Nikon sues Sigma over VR patents. And Twitter unveils photo and video sharing.

episodes.title: 203: The White House Keeps It Real
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: The White House says "keep it real". Hasselblad cranks it up to 200 megapixels, and iPads get color corrected.

episodes.title: 202: Trading Fear for Photos
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: In case of a water landing, take pictures. Adobe gets touchy-feely. And an interview with Reid Warner from SnapKnot.com.

episodes.title: 201: Flashpoint
episodes.author: Alex Lindsay
episodes.summary: Women Photoshopped out of a White House Photo. Jason Groupp sets a world record for photography. Getting the most out of your digital sensor. And Panasonic releases the G3.

episodes.title: 200: The Boys Are Back in Town
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: It's our 200th episode and The Boys are back in town! The original super friends reassemble. There's much ado about video. And an interview with photographer David Ziser.

episodes.title: 199: TWiP Interviews: Heather Champ
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: An interview with Heather Champ, a life-long camera junkie, former Director of Flickr Community, and co-founder of JPG Magazine.

episodes.title: 198: Viva Las Vegas!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Can you tell the difference between the Las Vegas Statue of Liberty and the real one? Well if you can, tell the U.S. Post Office. Also layers in Lightroom and an interview with photographer Matthew Jordan Smith.

episodes.title: 197: For Rent: Photoshop
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Adobe jumps into the subscription model business. Instagram escapes the Matrix and are film cameras finally dead?

episodes.title: 196: Inspiration
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Getting and staying inspired. Should female photographers go to war? And Lensbaby releases some new blur.

episodes.title: 195: iPad for Professional Photography?
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Is the iPad becoming a serious photographer's tool? In-camera retouching for point-and-shoots and an interview with self portrait photographer Natalie Dybisz.

episodes.title: 194: In Living Color
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Another mobile photo application enters the fray after raising 41 million bucks. Printing more can actually save you money and an interview with Web marketing guru Zach Prez.

episodes.title: 193: Japan
episodes.author: Alex Lindsay
episodes.summary: Canon and Nikon shut down major lens production factories. Spying on Polar Bears and gambling on faked exit data.

episodes.title: 192: Lady Gaga’s Poker Face on Copyright
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Lady Gaga demands the rights to concert photographs. Laser focusing to replace the dreaded focus hunt and one New Yorker's quest to return a lost roll of film ends in Paris. Plus a special interview with Mr. Trey Ratcliff.

episodes.title: 191: Through The Lens
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Holga Lens on your DSLR. Shooting with the Lensbaby and Special Guest Dave Metz of Sigma sets the record straight.

episodes.title: 190: The Furious Five!
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Public outcry causes a photographer to drop a copyright lawsuit. Tamron and Nikon are readying built-in Image Stabilizers in their Tele-extenders. Steve Simon joins in "randomly," and an interview on photosharing sites with PurePhoto.com CEO, John Ellis.

episodes.title: 189: Have Your Cake and Eat it Too
episodes.author: Frederick Van Johnson
episodes.summary: Are Carl Zeiss lenses really better? Sony opens the email kimono and Juan Pons and Rick Sammon of the Digital Photography Experience join the fray.

episodes.title: 188: Exposing Danger
